009package Ch08_Binary_Regions;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
014import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
020import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
021import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
022import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
023import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
024import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
025import imagingbook.common.regions.RegionContourSegmentation;
026import imagingbook.core.plugin.IjPluginName;
027import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
028
029import java.awt.*;
030import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
031import java.util.List;
032
033import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
034import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
035import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
036
037/**
038 * <p>
039 * Performs binary region segmentation, then displays each region's major axis (scaled by eccentricity) and equivalent
040 * ellipse as a vector overlay. See Sec. 8.6.2 and 8.6.3 of [1] for additional details. This plugin expects a binary
041 * (black and white) image with background = 0 and foreground &gt; 0. Display lookup tables (LUTs) are not considered.
042 * Eccentricity values are limited to {@link #MaxEccentricity}, axes are marked red if exceeded. Axes for regions with
043 * {@code NaN} eccentricity value (single-pixel regions) are not displayed. Axis and ellipse parameters are calculated
044 * from the region's central moments. If no image is currently open, the plugin optionally loads a suitable sample
045 * image.
046 * </p>
047 * <p>
048 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
049 * (2022).
050 * </p>
051 *
052 * @author WB
053 * @version 2022/12/08
054 */
055@IjPluginName("Region Eccentricity/Ellipse Demo")
056public class Region_Eccentricity_Ellipse_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
057        
058        /** Neighborhood type used for region segmentation (4- or 8-neighborhood). */
059        public static NeighborhoodType2D Neighborhood = NeighborhoodType2D.N4;
060        
061        /** Eccentricity scale factor applied to the length of the region's major axis. */
062        public static double    AxisEccentricityScale = 1.0;
063        /** Minimum region size, smaller regions are ignored. */
064        public static int               MinRegionSize = 10;
065        /** Maximum eccentricity, greater eccentricity values are clipped. */
066        public static double    MaxEccentricity = 100;
067        
068        /** Color used for drawing the major axis. */
069        public static Color     AxisColor = Color.magenta;
070        /** Color used for drawing the major axis if maximum eccentricity exceeded. */
071        public static Color     AxisColorCLipped = Color.red;
072        /** Color used for drawing the region's center. */
073        public static Color             CenterColor = Color.orange;
074        /** Color used for drawing the region's equivalent ellipse. */
075        public static Color             EllipseColor = Color.green;
076        /** Line width used for drawing the region's axes. */
077        public static double    AxisLineWidth = 1.5;
078        /** Size (radius) of the region's center mark. */
079        public static double    CenterMarkSize = 3;
080        /** Line width used for drawing the region's center. */
081        public static double    CenterLineWidth = 0.75;
082        
083        /** Set true to show the regions's centroid. */
084        public static boolean   ShowCenterMark = true;
085        /** Set true to show the region's major axis (length scaled by eccentricity). */
086        public static boolean   ShowMajorAxis = true;
087        /** Set true to show the region's equivalent ellipse. */
088        public static boolean   ShowEllipse = true;
089        
090        private ImagePlus im = null;
091        
092        /**
093         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
094         */
095        public Region_Eccentricity_Ellipse_Demo() {
096                if (noCurrentImage()) {
097                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.ToolsSmall);
098                }
099        }
100
101        @Override
102        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
103                this.im = im;
104                return DOES_8G;
105        }
106
107        @Override
108        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
109                if (!IjUtils.isBinary(ip)) {
110                        IJ.showMessage("Plugin requires a binary image!");
111                        return;
112                }
113                
114                if (!runDialog()) {
115                        return;
116                }
117                
118                int w = ip.getWidth();
119                int h = ip.getHeight();
120                double unitLength = sqrt(w * h) * 0.005 * AxisEccentricityScale;                        
121
122                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
123                
124                // perform region segmentation:
125                RegionContourSegmentation segmenter = new RegionContourSegmentation((ByteProcessor) ip, Neighborhood);
126                List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmenter.getRegions();
127
128                for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
129                        int n = r.getSize();
130                        if (n < MinRegionSize) {
131                                continue;
132                        }
133                        
134                        Pnt2d ctr = r.getCenter();
135                        
136                        if (ShowCenterMark) {
137                                ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(CenterLineWidth, CenterColor));
138                                // ola.addShape(makeCenterMark(xc, yc));
139                                ola.addShape(ctr.getShape(CenterMarkSize));
140                        }
141                        
142                        double[] mu = r.getCentralMoments();    // = (mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11)
143                        double mu20 = mu[0];
144                        double mu02 = mu[1];
145                        double mu11 = mu[2];
146                        
147                        double theta = 0.5 * Math.atan2(2 * mu11, mu20 - mu02); // axis angle   
148                                
149                        // calculate eccentricity from 2nd-order region moments:
150                        double A = mu20 + mu02;
151                        double B = sqr(mu20 - mu02) + 4 * sqr(mu11);
152                        if (B < 0) {
153                                throw new RuntimeException("negative value in eccentricity calculation: B = " + B); // this should never happen
154                        }               
155                        double a1 = A + sqrt(B);                // see book 2nd ed, eq. 10.34
156                        double a2 = A - sqrt(B);
157                        double ecc = a1 / a2;           
158                        
159                        if (ShowMajorAxis && !Double.isNaN(ecc)) {
160                                Color axisCol = AxisColor;                      // default color
161                                if (ecc > MaxEccentricity) {            // limit eccentricity (may be infinite)
162                                        ecc = MaxEccentricity;
163                                        axisCol = AxisColorCLipped;             // mark as beyond maximum
164                                }
165                                double len = ecc * unitLength;
166                                double dx = Math.cos(theta) * len;
167                                double dy = Math.sin(theta) * len;;
168                                double xc = ctr.getX();
169                                double yc = ctr.getY();
170                                ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(AxisLineWidth, axisCol));
171                                ola.addShape(new Line2D.Double(xc, yc, xc + dx, yc + dy));
172                        }
173                        
174                        if (ShowEllipse) {
175                                GeometricEllipse ellipse = r.getEquivalentEllipse();
176                                if (ellipse != null) {
177                                        ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(AxisLineWidth, EllipseColor));
178                                        ola.addShape(ellipse.getShape());
179                                }
180                        }       
181                }
182                
183                im.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
184        }
185        
186        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
187        
188        private boolean runDialog() {
189                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
190                gd.addEnumChoice("Neighborhood type", Neighborhood);
191                gd.addNumericField("Min. region size (pixels)", MinRegionSize, 0);
192                gd.addNumericField("Max. eccentricity", MaxEccentricity, 0);
193                gd.addNumericField("Axis scale", AxisEccentricityScale, 1);
194                gd.addCheckbox("Show center marks", ShowCenterMark);
195                gd.addCheckbox("Show major axes", ShowMajorAxis);
196                gd.addCheckbox("Show ellipses", ShowEllipse);
197                                
198                gd.showDialog();
199                if (gd.wasCanceled())
200                        return false;
201
202                Neighborhood = gd.getNextEnumChoice(NeighborhoodType2D.class);
203                MinRegionSize = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
204                MaxEccentricity = gd.getNextNumber();
205                AxisEccentricityScale = gd.getNextNumber();
206                
207                ShowCenterMark = gd.getNextBoolean();
208                ShowMajorAxis = gd.getNextBoolean();
209                ShowEllipse = gd.getNextBoolean();
210                return true;
211        }
212
213}
